Title: PhotoAlbumWorkflow
Description: A WPF application which reads and writes EXIF metadata on pictures. Written in C# using WPF. Renames files, sets title, and changes date properties.
HomeWiki:
Project Description
A WPF application which reads and writes EXIF metadata on pictures. Written in C# using WPF. Renames files, sets title, and changes date properties.

I started this project as a way to practice WPF data binding. Now I use it every time I import pictures from my camera.
  1. I import the pictures
  2. I delete bad pictures and post process good ones in WLPG
  3. I copy the pictures to PhotoAlbumWorkflow
  4. I bulk rename the pictures without more specific filenames in PAW
  5. I set the title to the file name in PAW
  6. If a timestamp is out of whack I set the time stamp (for instance on a collage).

The setting of the timestamps came about because someone that I help manage their pictures library had a camera whose year settings was set to five years in the future. While I can't get the exact timestamp that the picture should be, I can use the existing timestamps on the picture to set the out of whack ones to something reasonable.
